dataset.title: Bonanza Creek Experimental Forest GIS Data: Spot 5 Imagery

address.deliveryPoint: Boreal Ecology Cooperative Research Unit University of Alaska Fairbanks School of Agriculture and Land Resources Management P.O. Box 756780

para.literalLayout: Spot 5 pan-sharpened satellite image in the Standard Creek area of the Tanana Valley, Alaska. This image was acquired and processed as part of the "Vegetation and Community Mapping of the Tanana Valley" project, conducted cooperatively by the State of Alaska Department of Natural Resources, Division of Forestry and Tanana Chiefs Conference. Originator: State of Alaska, Dept. of Nat. Resources, Division of Forestry. Publication_Date: 3/21/05. Geospatial_Data_Presentation_Form: remote-sensing image.

While metadata will be freely available to those requesting it, the data manager will assure that any restrictions on access to data sets in the database will be enforced. Data will not be released without proper permission first being obtained from the investigator who generated the data.

Researchers should receive adequate acknowledgment for the use of their data by others and should be provided with copies of publications using their data. Users of data from the data base must be aware that data is not to be sold or redistributed.

It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists. Thus, the Data User will properly cite the Data Set in any publications or in the metadata of any derived data products that were produced using the Data Set.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: FP1A is located on a low early successional terrace (1.8 - 2 m above winter low river level) adjacent to the Tanana River. Vegetation establishment occurred in 1982 to 1983. Significant bank erosion has occurred since the establishment of the study area, resulting in loss of some study plots.

para.literalLayout: General community mapping, vegetation mapping, wildland fuels mapping, and general land use mapping.

Image was created by fusing a Spot 5 panchromatic image with a Spot 5 multi-spectral image, producing a multi-spectral image with 2.5m spatial resolution. The spatial accuracy of the image is dependent on the spatial accuracy of the images it was compiled from, which were orthorectified using ground control points collected with a resource-grade GPS reciever and terrain data from the National Elevation Dataset from USGS. Resulting horizontal accuracies are hoped to be on the order of 5 meters with a 90% confidence, but rigorous testing has not been conducted to verify this. In Areas of significant terrain we would expect lower horizontal accuracy. The image horizontal accuracy would be directly related to the hozizontal and vertical accuracy of the USGS DEM used to create the ortho-rectified image. The panchromatic and multi-spectral images were fused using the PANSHARP algroithm in PCI Geomatica. Channels 2 and 3 were used as reference image channels (green, red). The Green, Red and Near multi Infrared Spot 5 Bands are 10 meter resolution. The mid infrared band 4 is 20 meter resolution. This band is not included in this Tiff Image. A simulated blue band (band1) has been mathmatically created by multipling the green band by 3 and adding the infrared band and then dividing by 4. Displaying this image 2,1,3 will approximate a true color Image. Displaying the image 4,3,2 will Display the image as False color.
